document_data.name: Dead Man's Corner
document_data.mainbody:
The '''Dead Man's Corner''' was a ramshackle and crammed shop in [[Skullport]] that traded in [[human]] [[zombie]]s in the late 15{{th}} century [[DR]].
{{quote|''They're great for setting off traps!''|[[Olive Stillwater]], about her stock}}
document_data.Services: The shop was run by a [[sea hag]] disguised as an old woman named Olive Stillwater in the {{YearlinkName|1492}}. Her inventory included twelve zombies on average. Her corpses came with a leash for the buyer to drag their zombies around. These leashes were nooses around zombies' necks. Each shambler was sold for a humble price of a single vial of the buyer's blood and three hairs from their head.
